author: roehst
body:
Hi, I was able to install powershell from the .deb on Ubuntu 16.04, even though this failed:

$ sudo apt-get install libunwind8 libicu52
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree  
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package libicu52

Which is recommended in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/installation/linux.md#ubuntu-1604

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Just in case! I did separate the dependencies. I did had a successful installation
(Ahum! The *.deb package need to be downloaded first) 
:)

$ sudo apt-get install libunwind8
$ sudo apt-get install libicu52
$ cd Downloads
$ sudo dpkg -i powershell_6.0.0-alpha.9-1ubuntu1.14.04.1_amd64.deb

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Please look at the Ubuntu 16.04 instructions and the note that on that distribution, it's libicu55.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Good catch! I had the libicu55 because I was testing it on Windows Bash. Oops!
:P
Thanks

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: It's definitely a pretty annoying change in dependencies :)

title: (Non-)issue installing on Ubuntu 16.05
